reviews.text: I travel to Caracas regularly on business and have always stayed at the Tamanaco. On this trip, I decided to give the JW Marriott a shot and was very pleased.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

likes.liked: — The front desk staff is exceptional. The room was spotless.
likes.disliked: — The car service from/to the airport is outrageously expensive.

reviews.text: The front desk staff is extremely professional, courteous and just exceptional. Although my room was not ready when I arrived, I was asked to wait in the lobby while a room would be assigned. During the approximately 15 minutes that I was in the lobby waiting or outside smoking a cigarette, I was updated at least 3 times personally by a member of the staff as to the status of my room. Once the room was ready, I was pleased to learn that I had been upgraded to a suite; it was the only smoking room available and rather than give me the "I'm sorry, no more smoking rooms" I've gotten at other hotels, the staff generously gave me the suite so that I could be comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Bland hotel in an awful city
reviews.text: The room is exactly what you'd expect of a JW Marriott---exceptionally clean, well-stocked mini-bar, plush beds, extensive chocie of tv channels, etc., etc. Housekeeping came around at least twice a day to see if I needed anything, more water, more amenities, etc.

reviews.title: Loved the Marriott!
reviews.text: Negatives: just a few. First, the room service menu is very confusing in its lay-out and limited in what it offers. In a city where going out at night is not an option, I wish there would've a wider selection of items to choose and frankly, the food I did select was rather bland. Second, while you can actually walk around the immediate area during the daytime, it's not advisable to do so once it's dark. This is typical of Caracas; however, being stuck in a hotel that's somewhat cookie-cutter in design can get boring---the Tamanaco, while more "isolated", certainly has more atmosphere both during the day and night. Finally, the fare for car service to and from the airport is absurdly high---almost $95 each way!!!! In a country where gasoline is extremely cheap, this is a complete rip-off.

reviews.title: Great new Hotel in Caracas business district
reviews.text: Despite these minor issues, I was extremely pleased with the Marriott and will stay there or at the Tamanaco during my next trip to Caracas.
